title: Ukraine War Comes Home to Russia as Putin Imposes Draft
description: As Vladimir Putin’s “special military operation” enters a new chapter, Russians are being plucked from villages around the country for training and military service.

title: Your Friday Briefing: Men Flee Russian Conscription
description: Plus Japan props up the yen and Cambodia concludes its Khmer Rouge trials.

title: ‘One man chose this war.’ Harsh words fly at a U.N. Security Council meeting.
description: The meeting will bring the foreign ministers of the United States and Russia, along with European members of the Council, together around one table for the first time since Russia invaded Ukraine in February.

title: The U.S. Blasts Russia Over War at U.N. Security Council
description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken accused Russia of showing contempt for the U.N. Charter, saying the international order “is being shredded before our eyes.”

title: Russian Men, Fearing Ukraine Draft, Seek Refuge Abroad
description: Vladimir V. Putin’s new military call-up has sent young men who don’t want to fight in Ukraine heading to the borders.

title: Bill to Grant Afghan Evacuees a Path to Residency Hits Snags
description: The White House and members of both parties had hoped to attach the legislation to a must-pass spending bill this month. But some Republicans have raised security concerns.

title: Catholics Outnumber Protestants in Northern Ireland for the First Time
description: Newly released census results may fuel calls for a referendum on uniting Ireland, experts say, but not right away.

title: Water Problems in Syria Give Rise to Deadly Cholera Outbreak
description: The highly contagious disease has spread quickly in the country’s north, where millions of people displaced by a decade-long war are living, and many rely on untreated water from rivers containing raw sewage.

title: World Bank Leader, Accused of Climate Denial, Offers a New Response
description: David Malpass touched off a furor, including calls for his removal, when he refused to acknowledge that fossil fuels are warming the planet. On Thursday, he restated his position.

title: What to Know About Protests in Iran
description: Dozens of cities have been embroiled in protests that were prompted by a young woman’s death in custody but have escalated amid anger over religious rules and a rock-bottom economy.

title: Ukrainian Soldiers Are Freed. Joy Ripples Across the Country.
description: After the largest prisoner exchange of the war, Ukrainians celebrated while anger coursed through the ranks of Russian mercenaries and military bloggers.

title: 2 Michael Jackson Impersonators Look Identical. The Resemblance Ends There.
description: Two imitators of the King of Pop in Buenos Aires offer a study in contrasts, reflective of Argentina’s deep economic divide. One man financed 13 surgeries, while the other draws on his sideburns.

title: Waves of Russian Men Flee, Fearing Call-Up to Fight in Ukraine
description: Since the announcement of a new troop mobilization, civilians have realized they could not count on staying out of their country’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: Russia Begins Calling Up More Troops
description: School buses were reportedly bringing recruits to training grounds, a day after Moscow escalated its war effort by announcing the mobilization of up to 300,000 more soldiers.

title: At Least 1,252 People Are Detained in Protests in Russia
description: Protesters show their disapproval of the policy announced by President Vladimir V. Putin on Wednesday morning that would press 300,000 people into military service.

title: Andy Byford, Ex-M.T.A. Leader, Steps Down as London Transport Commissioner
description: Mr. Byford, who was revered as “Train Daddy” during his tenure as the chief of the New York City subway, said he would move back to the United States.

title: Bad to Worse for Russia
description: Vladimir Putin’s call-up of more troops highlights Russia’s continuing struggles in Ukraine.

title: Europe’s Shrinking Waterways Reveal Treasures, and Experts Are Worried
description: Drought combined with extreme heat this summer have painted a dramatic picture of Europe’s drying rivers and reservoirs.

title: Viktor Medvedchuk, a Putin Ally, Is Released in Russia-Ukraine Prisoner Swap
description: The Ukrainian politician and oligarch had acted as the Kremlin’s primary agent of influence in Ukraine for years.

title: In India, Debunking Fake News and Running Into the Authorities
description: Alt News, an independent website, has emerged as a leading debunker of misinformation in the nation, but highlighting hate speech against minorities has put it on a collision course with the government.

title: Protests in Iran Intensify Over the Death of Mahsa Amini in Custody
description: Unrest has spread to dozens of cities, with at least seven people killed, according to witnesses, rights groups and video posted on social media.

title: 16 Years, 3 Convictions: The Khmer Rouge Trials Come to an End
description: The last surviving leader of the regime that killed 1.7 million Cambodians lost his appeal on Thursday. Some victims think the long, expensive tribunal was a hollow exercise.

title: North Korea Denies U.S. Claims of Arms Sales to Russia
description: Pyongyang accused the United States of spreading “reckless” rumors, but added that it had the right to build and export arms.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: A warning from Vladimir Putin.

title: As Russia Retreats, a Question Lingers: Who Counts as a Collaborator?
description: In towns reclaimed from Russian occupation, Ukrainian officials are working to identify — and punish — those who helped the enemy. It’s dividing some communities.

title: Truss Pledges to Support Ukraine in Speech at U.N. General Assembly
William Ruto Warns About Climate Change at U.N. General Assembly
description: “We cannot afford to waste another moment debating the merits of doing something vis a vis doing nothing,” he said.
